text.div: No narrative is provided for definitional resources. A human-readable rendering can be found in the implementation guide(s) where this resource is used.

name: ZibPregnancy
title: zib Pregnancy
description: Pregnancy or gravidity is the condition in which a woman carries a fertilized egg, which grows into an embryo and then a fetus. A pregnancy of between 37 and 42 weeks is considered normal. “Term pregnancy” is 37 to 42 weeks. The term gravidity is also used for the number of times a woman has been pregnant. This and parity - the number of times a woman has given birth - provides insight into the patient’s obstetric history.
purpose: This Observation resource represents the Dutch [zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) Pregnancy v4.0 (2020)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/Pregnancy-v4.0(2020EN)).

element.comment:
Several concepts of zib Pregnancy are represented using distinct Observation resources. These are grouped using the current resource and are referenced on `Observation.hasMember`:

* [zib-Pregnancy.DateLastMenstruation](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.DateLastMenstruation)
* [zib-Pregnancy.EstimatedDateOfDelivery](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.EstimatedDateOfDelivery)
* [zib-Pregnancy.Gravidity](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.Gravidity)
* [zib-Pregnancy.Parity](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.Parity)
* [zib-Pregnancy.PregnancyDuration](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.PregnancyDuration)
